article:
{{Multiple issues
 | refimprove=July 2009 external links=November 2010
}} The following companies manufacture, or have manufactured, model aircraft.



*3D Hobby Shop *12 Squared *Academy Minicraft (Korea)
*Academy Plastic Model Co. *[http://www.acemodel.com.ua/ Ace] *Ace
Hobby *Accurate Miniatures (USA) *Adams *Addar *Advent *AER-Moldova *Aeroclub
(UK) *Aero Team (Czech Republic) *AGA *AHM *Airfix (UK) - from 1950 to present
*AIRFrame (The Aviation Workshop/Model Alliance) (UK) *Air Lines *Airmodel
[http://www.airmodel.de Airmodel Products] *Alanger (Russia) - re-boxed many ICM
kits. Went bankrupt in 2008; molds (mostly) taken over by ARK-models *Alfa
(Russia) *Aliplast *Alliance *AML (Czech Republic) *AMT (bought by ERTL
toys)[http://www.ertltoys.com/] (no longer manufacture aircraft models) *AMT-
Frog *AMT Hasegawa *AMT-Matchbox *Amodel (Ukraine) *[http://www.anigrand.com/
Anigrand Craftswork] (resin, Hong Kong) *Anna*Co. *Aoshima (Japan) *Apex *Arc En
Ciel *Arii *Ardpol (Poland) *Arsenal (Russia) *[http://www.ark-
model.com/catalog.php ARK-models] (Russia; ex-Alanger) *ART model (Ukraine)
*Aurora Plastics Corporation (sold their molds to Monogram in 1977, and later

*Dakoplast (Russia) *D&M Daneplane (Denmark. "Nielsen & Winther Aa" Vacu kit)

mainly flying models but some plastic kits *Ki-Tech (Hobbycraft Canada
production in China) *KitPro *Kiwi Wings (see Tasman Model Products) *Kombe
Models (Denmark. "O-maskine IO/IIO" resin kit) *Korpak (Belarus, ex-Mir) *Kora
Models (resin, Czech Republic) *KoPro (Czech Republic) *KP (KovozÃ¡vody
ProstÄjov, Czechoslovakia) *[http://www.kp-models.com KP Models] (HU) - from
1969 to present *Koster*Enterprises (USA) Maker of very high quality mixed media
vacuform conversions and complete subjects *KovozÃ¡vody Semily (Czechoslovakia)
*Legato (Czech Republic) *Leoman Brothers (USA) Ceased production of limited run
resin kits upon death of company principle *Leoman reformed, used formers'
masters, maker "The Other Guys" series, Soviet subjects *Libramodels *Lincoln
International *Lindberg *L&S (Japan) *LF Models (resin, Czech Republic) *Long
(In Africa, & Prosper) *Mac *Maquette (Russia) *Master Craft (Poland) *Matchbox
UK, bought AMT in 1972 and started own 1/72 aircraft and vehicles. ceased
production some moulds taken over by Revell Germany *Mauve *Meikraft (USA)
Ceased production of limited run plastic kits, later kits of are of very good
quality *Merit (British) ceased production of plastic model aircraft sometime in
the late 1950s *Merlin *Mikro72 (Poland) *MikroMir (Ukraine) *Minicopter
(German) [http://www.minicopter.de] *Minicraft Model Kits, Inc. *MiniHobbyModels
*Mir (Belarus; renamed to Korpak) *Mirage (Poland) *Mister Kit *ModelArt
*Modelcraft *[http://www.modelairplanefactory.com/ Model Airplane Factory]
*Model Factory *Modela (Czechoslovakia) *Modelik *[http://modelist.spb.ru/

*Modelland *Model Russia *Monogram (bought by Revell)
*[http://www.mountainmodels.com/ Mountain Models] *MPC *MPM (Czech Republic)

*[http://www.sweetaviationmodels.com/ Sweet] *Sword (Czech Republic) *Tamiya
(Japan) *[http://www.jaysmodelkits.com/ Tasman Model Products] Now based in
Christchurch, NZ 2012 Telink Czhek *Testors *Testors-Fujimi *Testors-Italeri (USA-
Italy) *[http://www.themodelairplane.com The Model Airplane] *Toga *Toko
(Ukraine) *Trumpeter (People's Republic of China) *Twisted Hobbys *Unda
(Moldova) *UPC (USA) Produced and re-packaged kits n the 1960s from Frog,
Lindberg, Tamiya, Hasegawa, ITC & many Japanese companies, specialised in the
buying up of other firm's moulds and re-issuing them under their own name.
